faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. British, German, Swedish, and other international buyers purchase Spanish property without restriction. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number) from Spanish immigration, then proceed through standard conveyancing with Spanish solicitor. Many international families complete purchases efficiently—the process takes 8-12 weeks. Your lawyer handles legal details; you focus on your new family home.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Beyond the €360,000 purchase price, expect: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.3-0.5%), land registry (0.1%), and solicitor fees (0.3-0.5%)—typically totaling 7-12% of purchase price. Annual costs include property tax (typically €300-€500 yearly), community fees if applicable, and utilities. Mortgage borrowing available at competitive rates. Budget €30,000-€40,000 for purchase completion costs on this €360,000 property.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Living costs in La Romana run 20-30% less than equivalent UK lifestyle. A family of four budgets €1,800-€2,500 monthly including rent, utilities, food, transport, and leisure. Supermarket shopping costs 15-25% less than UK. Healthcare is subsidized for residents. Schools are free (public) or €300-€400 monthly (international). Utilities average €100-€150 monthly. Your €360,000 investment then generates rental income offsetting ownership costs.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, international buyers obtain Spanish mortgages routinely. Spanish banks lend 70-80% of property value to established buyers with income documentation. Interest rates run 3-4% for EU citizens, sometimes slightly higher for non-EU. You'll need: property valuation, proof of income (employment letter or pension statement), identification, and NIE. British pension income qualifies perfectly. The process takes 4-6 weeks. Many families combine savings with modest mortgages for optimal cash flow.

faqs.answer: Direct flights from Alicante Airport to London, Manchester, and other UK cities take 2-2.5 hours. This villa sits 25 minutes from Alicante Airport, so you're roughly 3 hours total from UK home. Flights operate multiple times daily, especially summer. Return costs typically €60-€120. Many families maintain UK connections—visiting grandparents remains genuinely feasible for long weekends.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: La Romana enjoys 300 days of annual sunshine with warm Mediterranean climate. Summers reach 28-32°C (82-90°F) with low humidity. Winters average 10-15°C (50-59°F)—rarely freezing, perfect for outdoor living. Rainfall concentrates in autumn and spring. The climate supports year-round outdoor family activities: beach swimming May-October, hiking and outdoor sports throughout winter, gardening practically year-round. You'll genuinely reduce heating costs and increase outdoor living.

British, German, Swedish, and Dutch families cluster here, creating natural friendships. Spouses find employment through English-speaking networks. Children make friends quickly in schools with international cohorts. The neighborhood celebrates cultural diversity—you maintain home traditions while adopting Spanish lifestyle. Many families report stronger community bonds here than in their home countries.
